title: Làm bài luyện đọc | Luyện đề VSTEP

reading.title: Làm bài luyện đọc | Luyện đề VSTEP

passages.content:
Câu 1: The passage answers which of the following questions?
A. What instruments comprised a typical jazz band of the 1920's?
B. Which early jazz musicians most influenced rhythmand blues music?
C. Why is dancing closely related to popular music in the United States?
D. What are the differences between jazz and other forms of music?
Câu 2: Which of the following appeared before jazz as a popular music for dancing?
A. Disco
B. Rhythm and blues
C. Ragtime
D. Rock
Câu 3: According to the passage, jazz musicians are able to demonstrate their individual artistry mainly by?
A. reading music with great skill
B. preparing musical arrangements
C. being able to play all types of popular music
D. creating musical variations while performing
Câu 4: Which of the following was the function of "get-off" musicians?
A. Lead the band
B. Teach dance routines created for new music
C. Assist the other band members in packing up after a performance
D. Provide solo performances in a band or orchestra
Câu 5: Which two types of music emerged during the same era?
A. Jazz/Dance
B. Rock/Rhythm & Blues
C. Dance/Rhythm & Blues
D. Jazz/Rock
Câu 6: Louis Armstrong was mentioned as an influential musician in which jazz style?
A. Hot jazz / Swing jazz
B. Structured jazz
C. Big band jazz
D. Chorus-based jazz
Câu 7: The word "consciously" is closest in meaning to
A. carelessly
B. purposely
C. easily
D. periodically
Câu 8: The word "unadorned" is closest in meaning to
A. inexpensive
B. lovely
C. disorganized
D. plain
Câu 9: Which of the following terms is defined in the passage?
A. cornet player
B. improvisation
C. multichorus
D. polyphony
Câu 10: The topic of the passage is developed primarily by means of
A. presenting contrasting points of views
B. dividing the discussion into two major areas
C. describing historical events in sequence
D. providing biographies of famous musician

options.A: What instruments comprised a typical jazz band of the 1920's?
options.B: Which early jazz musicians most influenced rhythmand blues music?
options.C: Why is dancing closely related to popular music in the United States?
options.D: What are the differences between jazz and other forms of music?

options.C: being able to play all types of popular music

options.B: Teach dance routines created for new music
options.C: Assist the other band members in packing up after a performance
options.D: Provide solo performances in a band or orchestra

options.B: dividing the discussion into two major areas
